author: owocki
content:
Hey all,

I saw the AMA that the ETH2 team did on reddit last week, and thought it was a super informative update on ETH2.  Very useful for dispelling myths + articulating the designs of ETH2.

I'm wondering if this group would consider coming on the Gitcoin livestream sometime and doing a roundtable with a couple gitcoin community leaders who will be peppering in questions about your work.

In the past we've taken content like this and spliced it up into digestible youtube clips, which then were a pretty big hit on twitter/reddit - driving thousands of views.  Here is an example https://gitcoin.co/blog/eth-2-0-qa-with-key-developers/

I think its very important that the community is able to understand the design, implementation, and importance of the future of ETH.  So we'd be happy to be of service by giving you a platform to talk about these things!

Time investment would be an hour per person, we'd need 3-4 of you to make the show work.  We typically do livestreams every Friday at 2pm EST.  
Does any of the following work for you?
- July 17
- July 24
- July 31
- August 7
